conbody.p: originsUDP Multithreaded SourceUDP Multithreaded Source originoverviewThe UDP Multithreaded Source origin reads messages from one or more UDP ports. The origin can create multiple worker threads to enable parallel processing in a multithreaded pipeline.
UDP Multithreaded Source generates a record for every message. UDP Multithreaded Source
The origin can also read binary or character-based raw data.

When you configure UDP Multithreaded Source, you specify the ports to use and the batch size and wait time. You specify the number of worker threads to use in multithreaded processing and you can specify the packet queue size. When epoll is available on the machine, you can also specify the number of receiver threads to use to increase the throughput of packets to the pipeline.
You specify the data format for the data, then configure any related properties.
